definition: "speech" or "words" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 149)/see also 言字旁[yan2 zi4 pang2]
to translate and edit/translator-editor/(computing) to compile (source code)

transliteration (rendering phonetic value, e.g. of English words in Chinese characters)/characters giving phonetic value of Chinese word or name (when the correct characters may be unknown)/transcription (linguistics)/to transcribe phonetic symbols
to break a code/to crack a riddle/to solve an enigma/a breakthrough

sentences.english: we can offer: Website translation service, language interpretation service, editing service, proofread-ing service and more
sentences.chinese: 相关的俄文或英文文件翻译及俄汉口译工作。

sentences.english: So I told her that Disciple Stanley would be the suitable person to do it.
sentences.chinese: 因此我告诉她弟子成穗是译此文的合适人选。

sentences.english: At present, homophonic transliteration has become a fashion in the translation of trademarks.
sentences.chinese: 时下，谐音译在商标翻译中成为一种时髦。
又译为自我开放或自我揭示。

sentences.english: We all know listening, speaking, reading, writing and translating are closely related.
sentences.chinese: 我们都知道，听说读写译是密切相关的。

sentences.english: The cool drink was garnished with a slice of lemon.
sentences.chinese: 译这种冷饮用了一片柠檬作装饰。

sentences.english: Ancient poetry word middle have the verse "translating" the sum "day lily"?
sentences.chinese: 古诗词中有“译”和“萱”的诗句么？

sentences.english: A collection of Mongolian epitaphs of Yuan dynasty translated into Mandarin Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 书中所集之碑文均为译自元代蒙古语的公牍。

sentences.english: One may sooner fall than rise.
When translating the source poem, the translator employs the iconic forms to render the iconicity of the source poem.
sentences.chinese: 译者在译原诗时要使用象似形式体现象似性。

sentences.english: A lot of American movies have been dubbed into Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 很多美国电影都被译制成了中文。

sentences.english: Bill Clinton previously served as the governor of Arkansas.
sentences.chinese: “克林顿以前曾做过阿肯色州州长”这句话该如何译？

sentences.english: The housewife haggled over the price with the vendor for half an hour.
sentences.chinese: 译这个主妇同小贩讨价还价了半个小时。

sentences.english: Paid human translators, unsurprisingly, still produce the best results.
sentences.chinese: 当然，有偿的人工繙译质量最好。

sentences.english: His evil intentions were manifest and yet we could not stop him.
sentences.chinese: 译他的险恶用心表露无遗，但是我们却没办法阻止他。

sentences.english: There is no simple nostrum for political and social evils.
sentences.chinese: 译对付政治和社会罪恶没有简单的妙方。

definition: United Kingdom/British/England/English/abbr. for 英國|英国[Ying1 guo2]
to translate again (i.e. to redo the same translation)/to translate repeatedly from one language to the next (so multiplying errors)
